message: I’m honored once again to be given this opportunity to continue serving the people of South Mississippi.  The 115th Congress is the turning point that we have been working toward over the last eight years.  I’m ready to pick up where we left off in the 114th Congress, protecting and defending the values of South Mississippians, and the principles our great nation was founded upon.

Today the House approved a resolution to build a memorial in Washington, DC that will commemorate military members who served in operations Desert Shield and Desert Storm.    As a veteran of the Persian Gulf War I appreciate all of the hard work by Congressman Phil Roe who introduced this resolution as well as the National Desert Storm War Memorial Committee who has worked tirelessly to see this project through.

This week I re-introduced my legislation that would impose term limits on Members of the House and Senate. The bill would limit members of Congress to twelve years of service, six terms in the House or two terms in the Senate.    I personally believe our nation would be much better off if there were no career politicians. That is why I have introduced a term limits bill for the last three Congresses that forces politicians to go back home and live under the same laws they created, knowing they will likely do less damage to our country and work more to improve the lives of hardworking Americans.

This week I was named to the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Homeland Security.  The first priority of Congress should always be the defense of our nation. As both a Congressman and a Marine, I took an oath to protect this nation against all enemies foreign and domestic. My service on the Homeland Security Appropriations subcommittee will undoubtedly allow me to continue fighting to protect our nation.  With President Trump and Republican majorities in Congress, this subcommittee will be able to fight to secure and fortify our borders, combat amnesty and illegal immigration, develop cyber technologies against foreign threats, and safeguard our homeland from terrorism and natural disasters.  I want to thank Chairman Frelinghuysen for his faith in me, and I look forward to working to make America Safe Again and to serving the needs of all South Mississippians.

As we approach one of the most exciting Presidential Inaugurations we have seen in our lifetimes, I'd like to challenge your knowledge about this historical ceremony. So starting Monday, I'll be posting trivia questions daily about past inaugurations and presidents.    **Rules: Reply with your answer within four hours of the original post. A correct answer is worth one point.  The contestants with the most points after the trivia questions have ended on January 19 will win an American flag that was flown over the U.S. Capitol on the day of President Trump's Inauguration. You must reside in MS-04 to participate.    Make sure you tag your friends and family, so they can play too!   Competition ends on January 19 and the winner will be announced on social media on Monday, January 23. #Inauguration2017 #January20

I've been in the Pine Belt today surveying tornado damage and the devastation is truly unbelievable. Please stay safe and off the roads and continue to pray for our community.   If you need emergency assistance, dial 911 or call the city action line at 601-545-4500.  There are shelters open at the Forrest County Multipurpose Center (962 Sullivan Drive, Hattiesburg) and Petal Civic Center (712 South Main Street).
If you are in need of resources or looking for ways to help others please visit this page on my website with a list of items that are needed, drop-off locations and open shelters.
Congratulations to Chuck Spase for winning the trivia competition last week! Thanks everyone for participating.

Saturday morning I rushed to the Pine Belt after learning of the devastation caused by the tornado earlier that morning.  While surveying the damage at William Carey I ran into the three young men in the picture below. They are international students and as they were sharing their story with me I was truly touched by what I heard.   They were driving on campus when the tornado hit throwing all 3 of them and their vehicle about 100ft.  After they got out of the car they noticed an American Flag on the ground and hung it up on that guard shack. When I asked why they did that they said, if it was their national flag from their country, they hope someone would do the same.  The respect and kindness they displayed with that small act makes me both proud and hopeful. That kind of goodwill among neighbors  is going to be the key to rebuilding and renewing our communities.

This week I re-introduced my Every Child is a Blessing Act, that would put a stop to controversial “wrongful birth” lawsuits, in which parents claim that had they known a child would have a developmental or physical disability, they would have aborted the pregnancy.   I believe in the sanctity of human life and that every child is a blessing.  That is why I am reintroducing this legislation today as thousands of Americans make the annual “March for Life” to the Supreme Court, including students from the Catholic Diocese of Biloxi, to show their support for the unborn.   I will continue to do everything in my power as a Congressman and as a person to be a voice for the voiceless and a defender of the defenseless.

It was truly remarkable to witness the swearing in of President Trump. I asked constituents to share their photos with me, check out the great pictures from my open house and several from the swearing in ceremony. #Inauguration2017

I personally believe we must invest our time in the upcoming generation of leaders.   If you or someone you know is interested in an internship, please follow the link at the bottom of this post.   I am able to provide internship opportunities through my offices in both DC and Mississippi. Internships run through the spring, summer, and fall semester for college students. You will get the opportunity to see the legislative process up close and gain professional experience in the process.   Once again, if you are interested please follow the link below.   Please contact my office if you have any questions, 202-225-5772.   http://palazzo.house.gov/constituent-services/internships.htm
Great to meet with the Jackson County Utility Authority today!
Read my statement on President Trump's Supreme Court nominee, Judge Neil Gorsuch.   http://palazzo.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398996

Thank you to WDAM for hosting this telethon to raise money for tornado recovery efforts!    I urge everyone to make a donation today, big or small. This is going to be a long road to recovery for many of our friends, family and neighbors and every little bit helps.
Great to meet with members of the Mississippi United Pentecostal Church International in Washington today.
I enjoyed sitting down with the Habitat for Humanity Mississippi Gulf Coast President Mr. Chris Monforton
Good to speak with members of the Mississippi Prosecutors Association today.

Join me as I will be hosting a telephone town hall tonight at 6:05 p.m. CT.  If you haven't previously participated in one of my teletown halls and would like to join in tonight, please follow the link on this post to send your name and phone number in an email to my website. I look forward to hearing from you soon!   http://palazzo.house.gov/contact/
It was great to meet with members of the Mississippi Rural Water Association yesterday in Washington!
Nice to sit down and meet with representatives from Rush Health Systems today.

Friday I visited NASA's Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans that was impacted by the tornado that struck the area Tuesday.    As a member of the Commerce, Justice and Science Appropriations Subcommittee that has jurisdiction over NASA’s annual budget, I believe it was important to get a firsthand look at the damages and have an opportunity to speak with the director and employees that will be impacted by this as we begin the recovery process.

This morning I had the pleasure of addressing my brothers and sisters of the National Guard at a workshop in Washington, D.C.   While speaking to these members, I mentioned that General Mattis is a leader who understands that our national debt is the number one threat to America right now. President Trump has asked for increased defense spending, which will reset and preserve the force, as well as ensure our readiness in the face of any potential conflict.   An important part of keeping a ready force is taking care of those who serve, paying them the benefits they HAVE EARNED, and making sure they have a smooth transition back to civilian life.   I'm working with Congressman Tim Walz on introducing legislation that will ensure that many of our National Guardsmen are not excluded from the benefits they've earned. Our service men and women have been pushed aside for too long and that stops now.  Thank you to all the families and members of the National Guard for all that you do supporting and defending our country.
I met with Horne CPA this morning, the largest CPA firm in Mississippi, to hear their ideas and get feedback on the upcoming tax reform bill.

It is a great honor to be named Vice Chairman of the House Appropriations Committee's Subcommittee on Homeland Security.   My priority is to keep Americans safe at home and abroad, and I look forward to continuing to do so.

This week the U.S. Navy Seabees celebrated their 75th Anniversary!   Since 1942 Seabees have served our country bravely during conflicts and played a vital role in communities and nations around the world. Our Seabees in South Mississippi are no exception, and I commend their hard work both here at home and abroad.
I enjoyed attending and speaking during the Jackson County Republican Women's meeting today!
Happy 100th Birthday to Ms. Marion Ritchie! I was honored to be a part of this special celebration.

Today I spoke on the House floor today in support of the FY 2017 Defense Appropriations bill.   I have long said that the number one Constitutional responsibility of this body is the common defense of this nation, and today the appropriations committee under the leadership of Chairman Frelinghuysen has once again shown the importance that we place on this most sacred duty.   This appropriations bill takes the first steps towards rebuilding our military and showing our allies they can trust us, and showing our enemies they should fear us.

Yesterday morning my Co-Chairman, Congressman Walz and I hosted the annual National Guard and Reserve Component Caucus breakfast.    Reserve Component Chiefs from every service were represented and had the opportunity to share their priorities. I look forward to working with each of them to ensure the continued success of our National Guard and Reserve Component service members.
NA
Happy #NationalAgDay to our South Mississippi farmers! Thank you for all of your hard work. Pictured below, Eubanks Produce in George County

One of the reasons I was elected in 2010 was to repeal Obamacare, and I remain 100% committed to repealing this disastrous law.   President Trump and Speaker Ryan should be commended for their efforts to get this bill across the finish line this week, but unfortunately, we came up just short. Legislating on such a complex issue is difficult at best, but we were elected to get the job done and we still intend to do so.   I stand by President Trump and our efforts to repeal Obamacare will continue, and we will go back to the drawing board to ensure we fix our broken healthcare system and replace Obamacare with bold, conservative solutions.

I’m happy to take part in the 2nd Annual Si Robertson Sporting Clay Shoot today benefitting Homes of Hope, a non-profit organization that provides housing and support for children in need.   Unfortunately, many children are faced with poor circumstances at home that are out of their control. Homes of Hope not only gives those children a home, but also provides them with the loving, nurturing environment they need and deserve.   I truly commend them for the work they are doing and also Si Robertson for traveling to Mississippi each year and supporting this worthy cause.

On Friday Mississippians came together to celebrate the 200th anniversary of Mississippi becoming the 20th state. The USPS debuted the Mississippi Statehood stamp. This stamp is dedicated to the Blues that started in Mississippi. Mr. Jimmy "Duck" Holmes is the playing the guitar on the right, and also featured on the stamp.   Mississippi became the 20th state in the Union on December 10, 1817, and was known as the Magnolia State. As we all know, Mississippi has given America famous writers, athletes and actors, and unmatched musical talent. What a great year this will be for the great state of Mississippi!
NA

President Trump has been in office 100 days.   My e-newsletter below highlights the promises that have been kept, the victories that have been won and the plans in place to ensure the future success of President Trump's conservative agenda for our country.

Join me tonight at 6 p.m. (CST) for my Tele-Town Hall meeting! If you are not already on my call list, please follow this link to submit your information and join tonight's discussion!  https://palazzo.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3265

Today NOAA announced that our red snapper season this year will be 3 days. In 2006, there were 193 days. In 2016, there were 11, and now we have 3.   The science and data being used to make these decisions is outdated and more importantly it does not take into account state-generated data or state input.   We need to put management of red snapper into the hands of the states, who are better equipped to assess the red snapper stocks off their own shores.   I was pleased today to welcome Jamie Miller, Executive Director of the Mississippi Department of Marine Resources, who testified before the House Oversight and Government Committee on this extremely important issue.
I'll be joining the JT Show on Supertalk this morning. Tune in at 10:00a.m. CST!

It’s National Police Week, a time to express our appreciation to the brave men and women who have made it their life's mission to enforce our laws and protect and serve our communities every day.   During this time we also recognize the officers who have lost their lives in the line of duty, as well as their families who live with that sacrifice each day.  While we can never take away the sorrow and burden of their loss, we can and will continue to honor their lives and their steadfast commitment to duty and service.
Had a great time supporting the Golden Eagles this weekend at the NCAA regional in Hattiesburg! Good luck today. #SMTTT
Today marks the the 73rd anniversary of D-Day.    May we always remember & honor those who bravely stormed the beaches of Normandy that day in the name of freedom.

I enjoyed the opportunity to meet with Wendy Mahoney, the Executive Director of the Mississippi Coalition Against Domestic Violence, to discuss the coalition's programs and training they provide that will help end domestic violence in the home and in Mississippi.
Join me tonight for a live discussion on the issues important to YOU!    To participate you can call 877-229-8493 and enter the PIN number 17629
I am safe and fine. Please pray for my colleagues and any staff and their families who were involved in this morning's shooting.
NA

It should come as no surprise that I’m THRILLED with the President’s executive action eliminating the Waters of the United States-WOTUS.   I know I don’t stand alone as many of our farmers, ranchers and businesses owners have been expressing their aversion to this overreaching EPA rule put into effect by the Obama Administration.    In 2015 the American people spoke up and Obama refused to listen but President Trump heard loud and clear and today took bold, necessary actions to help the hardworking people of our country

Two years ago this week, Kate Steinle was brutally murdered in a sanctuary city by an illegal immigrant who had been deported six times. The safety and security of this nation is our number one responsibility, and in order to keep our citizens safe, we have to know who is entering and living in our country.  Which is why Today the House passed H.R. 3003, No Sanctuary for Criminals Act and  H.R. 3004, Kate's Law. Together these bills ensure that taxpayers dollars are not being used to subsidize “sanctuary cities”, and to increase prison sentences for immigrants convicted of illegally re-entering the U.S. following deportation  The bills we passed today, along with President Trump’s travel ban being upheld by the Supreme Court this week, further protect our country and enforce the immigration laws on the books.  Securing our borders and deterring individuals from entering our country illegally are both imperative steps in ensuring American citizens are safe and secure.

At the White House today for President Trump's signing of an executive order to re-institute the National Space Council.   This is a great day for the future of the American Space Program, and it’s wonderful to have a President who has finally made these milestones in our space program a priority.   The National Space Council further supports the President’s agenda for space, as well as my goal to once again launch American astronauts, on American rockets, from American soil.
God Bless America and all who served and continue to serve our great nation. Hope you and your family have a safe and happy 4th of July!
I’m devastated by the news of the United States Marine Corps KC-130 aircraft crash last night. My prayers are with the family members of the 16 victims whose lives were lost.
NA
Enjoyed speaking with Harrison County Teenage Republican Chairman, Ethan Gemmill and Secretary, Launa Craig in my Washington, DC today!

The House just voted 419-3 to impose sanctions on Russia, Iran, and North Korea and fight to protect our national security.   This bill will hold these countries accountable, and I am pleased to see this bill pass with almost unanimous bipartisan support.

Last night I spoke on the House floor in support of the Make America Secure Appropriations Act.   The number one constitutional responsibility of Congress is to provide for the common defense of this nation against all enemies both domestic and foreign.   That commitment, by increasing defense funding and restoring the cuts and budget shortfalls that threaten our military readiness and our ability to project force around the globe, is honored in this bill.
NA

Today we recognize a distinguished group of men and women who served in our Armed Forces and were awarded the Purple Heart. Thank you is not enough to recognize the sacrifices they made while defending our country.   Take some time today to stop by the Purple Heart Memorial at the Biloxi Small Craft Harbor to remember America's heroes. #PurpleHeartDay

I'd like to thank the Jones County Republican Women for hosting me for lunch this week.   It was great to hear from the Mississippi Federation of Republican Women President, Dana Stringer about the upcoming 29th Biennial Convention in Gulfport. Sheriff Alex Hodge also provided updates on combatting drug trafficking and usage in Jones Co.   As always it was great to hear these positive updates and spend time in Jones Co.

I am thankful for the opportunity to have been the guest speaker at William Carey University's Tradition Campus Graduation. It was wonderful to see these students recognized for their hard work and accomplishments. Congratulations to all the WCU graduates! #CareyStrong

Here are some words you don’t hear very often from the mainstream media—GREAT NEWS!  Today President Trump signed into law the largest expansion of GI Bill benefits in a decade.   The bill also includes provisions from my own legislation to close a loophole the military was using to deny some benefits to the Guard and Reserve.   Mississippi has a strong tradition of supporting our veterans, and this is a big win for our Guard, Reserve and entire veteran community!

Planning a trip to Washington, D.C.? My DC office provides private tours of the U.S. Capitol Building throughout the year to visiting constituents. All you'll need to do is fill out the web form below to get the process started!   If you need further assistance, please contact my D.C. office.  https://palazzo.house.gov/constituent-services/washington-dc.htm

Today it was announced that the Navy has selected Ingalls Shipbuilding in Pascagoula as the recipient of the contract to repair the USS Fitzgerald, the ship that was damaged after colliding with a container ship off the coast of Japan in June of this year.   This tragic accident took the lives of seven sailors who will not be forgotten for their service, bravery and commitment to our country.    I have no doubt that Ingalls Shipbuilding is the right choice for the job of repairing and restoring the USS Fitzgerald to its former greatness, because it will be in the hands of the greatest ship builders on earth.
Tune in tomorrow at 8:30am for WLOX News This Week, as Dave Elliott and I discuss some of the issues facing our country - from Obamacare to tax reform and the President's new Afghanistan strategy.

I know many of us in South Mississippi are praying for the families and victims that are currently experiencing the devastation that accompanies a hurricane, and we should continue in our prayers.  I am including a link that lists ways you can help out hurricane victims, whether that is through donations to the Red Cross, Salvation Army, or other opportunities. Please continue praying for the victims, their families, and the state of Texas as they begin the recovery process.

Great day to be a Golden Eagle! #SMTTT
Great game tonight--Southern Miss fought hard and I'm proud to be a Golden Eagle! #SMTTT

Today I went with the U.S. Coast Guard to see  firsthand the damage in Texas from Hurricane Harvey.  It was a humbling experience to say the least.   I'm thankful to these brave men and women who continue to work day in and day out to rescue thousands from this disaster. I'll hope you will join me in praying for our responders and those still suffering from the devastation of Hurricane Harvey.

If anyone is evacuating to South Mississippi and needs assistance, please message me here on Facebook and we will do our best to assist you.   Please keep  all those in Hurricane Irma’s path in your prayers.

Today we remember and honor the brave & innocent men and women who lost their lives during the tragic events of September the 11th.   God Bless our first responders and all of our men and women who risk their lives each day both at home and abroad to protect our country, and God Bless the United States of America.

The House just passed all of the Appropriations bills for the first time in years.  These bills are prioritizing America's needs and making sure America comes first.   In these bills we fund national security, strengthen our border protections, raise the pay for military men and women, fund FEMA for disaster relief, increase funding for law enforcement, defend the second amendment, and defund planned parenthood.  Oh, did I mention these bills were passed through regular order and on time? It feels great to achieve conservative victories for our agenda and uphold promises that were made to all Americans!
Let's get to work on #TaxReform
This weekend I celebrated the USS Tripoli christening at Ingalls. We have the best shipbuilders in the world building the best ships in the world right here in South Mississippi!

My thoughts and prayers are with the families of the victims from last nights shooting as well as those who are injured.

Today, the House voted on H.R. 36 the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act.   This bill prohibits late-term elective abortions on unborn children after 20 weeks post-fertilization. Medical evidence shows that by 20 weeks, at the latest, unborn children can feel pain.   America should not be one of seven countries in the world that allows late-term legalized abortions. I am happy to support this common sense legislation and will continue to advocate for all pro-life policies.
It’s an honor to be selected as part of the 2017 #MSTop50 most influential leaders. I’m proud to be among so many outstanding Mississippians—Congrats to all!

I want to let you know that Academy Day 2017 is still happening on Saturday. I am monitoring Tropical Storm Nate and will provide updates if there are any changes.   Looking forward to seeing you there!

Here is a helpful guide to assist you as South Mississippi prepares for Tropical Storm Nate.   Please continue monitoring local officials websites for updates on Tropical Storm Nate.    https://palazzo.house.gov/uploadedfiles/hurricane_preparedness.pdf

Here is a list of storm shelters that will be open beginning tomorrow. Please remember, anyone seeking shelter at these locations should bring prescription medication, eyeglasses, sleeping gear, baby/infant items, and a change of clothes. Pets will not be allowed.
I wanted to remind you that Academy Day 2017 is still set to take place tomorrow morning at MGCCC's Jefferson Davis Campus. I hope to see you there! Registration begins at 8 a.m.

We had a very successful Academy Day event on Saturday! Thank you to all of our Service Academies, students and parents who attended despite the looming weather conditions.    If you were unable to be there this Saturday and are interested in attending a Service Academy I urge you to to visit my website palazzo.house.gov or contact my office at 228-864-7670 for more information.   The deadline to submit your application to my office for this year is November 15, 2017. Look forward to hearing from you!
Excited to announce that Becky Pruett Denham will be a guest speaker at the 2017 Palazzo Youth Leadership Summit next week!

Today President Trump signed an Executive Order that allows health insurance to be purchased across state lines. This will help foster a competitive national marketplace and lower the cost of healthcare.    We all know that Obamacare is failing and we cannot accept it as the status quo. That is why the House passed a repeal bill in May. That is why I signed a discharge petition for Obamacare on September 28.  I am committed to working with President Trump to repeal Obamacare.
My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord. Luke 1:46  So proud of my son, Bear, for his Confirmation last night. It has been a pleasure watching him grow into the man he is today.
Looking forward to the 2017 Palazzo Youth Leadership Summit next week! #PalazzoLeaders

The Palazzo Youth Leadership Summit gives high school juniors and seniors from schools across Mississippi's 4th Congressional District the opportunity to hear the success stories of our prestigious guest speakers.
My special guest today at the RS-25 engine test at Stennis — Laithen Ladner from Hancock North Central Elementary’s Flat Stanley!

Tomorrow night is the 39th Annual Salute to the Military on the Mississippi Gulf Coast. I’m once again honored to be a part of this event that is a great tribute to our men and women in uniform.   I'd like to thank Major General David G. Bellon for accepting my invitation and taking time out of his busy schedule to attend and serve as the featured guest speaker.

Today, Secretary Zinke announced that the Dept. of Interior is proposing the largest oil and gas lease in U.S. history. This is huge for Mississippi and the United States.    South Mississippi has the opportunity to lead the effort in exploring the 76.9 million acres in the Gulf of Mexico. Investing in American energy independence is an investment in hard-working Americans. It’s refreshing to see an Administration helping the U.S. work toward becoming energy independent powerhouse.

Thank you to Americans for Prosperity for hosting a productive discussion this morning at the MSU extension center regarding tax reform and healthcare. Today the house  passed a bill that will repeal the Independent Payment Advisory Board (IPAB). The IPAB has an overreaching, ghastly amount of control over healthcare decisions that will most specifically affect our senior citizens.  Federal bureaucrats shouldn’t be dictating from their offices in Washington how a patient should be treated. I believe our exceptionally well-qualified healthcare professionals in this country are best suited to diagnose and treat their patients in need of medical attention.  This legislation has passed the house before, but  now we have a President who is dedicated to fixing our healthcare system. I am hopeful that we will see this bill being signed in the President's office.

Great week in Washington! I'd like to provide you with a brief update of what happened in the House this week.   1) Yesterday, the House voted in favor of repealing the bureaucratic death panel known as the Independent Payment Advisory Board. This bill passed at 307-111 with support from both sides of the aisle.   2) Today, we passed a bill that will extend the Children's Health Insurance Program that thousands of Mississippi children depend on for healthcare coverage. It also included funding for Community Health Centers that provide comprehensive care throughout the entire state to over 280,000 Mississippians, and is completely offset.    3) Lastly, House Republicans rolled out our Tax Reform plan that will provide relief to hardworking American families. This bill will be marked up by the Ways and Means Committee next week. If you'd like to read more about our tax reform plan visit → https://fairandsimple.gop/   I'm happy to provide you with these updates, and hope you have a safe and happy weekend.

Last night the house voted to reauthorize the National Flood Insurance Program. I did not support the bill that was brought to the floor.  As I discussed in my Tele-Town hall last night, I’ve made South Mississippi’s priorities evidently clear and these were not included in the final package that came to the house floor, therefore leaving many on the Gulf Coast vulnerable to unaffordable premiums.  I remain committed to working toward a reformed NFIP that protects South Mississippians.

Today the House passed the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act. We just took a MAJOR step toward delivering real tax relief to hardworking Mississippians and Americans across the country.   You deserve jobs. You deserve fairer taxes. You deserve bigger paychecks. You and your family deserve a tax code that works for you!

As November comes to an end, I'd like to once again thank the brave men and women who have served and our currently serving in our armed forces. I'd also like to thank their families who support them while they are fulfilling their duties.   You may recall that November started off with Bowe Bergdahl, a traitor and deserter who abandoned his post in Afghanistan in 2009, was only sentenced to a dishonorable discharge. This man is a traitor and a coward. He should be paying for all the American blood spilled on his behalf.  I've recently become a cosponsor of HR 4437, which would prevent Bergdahl and other deserters from receiving ANY back pay.   This legislation is just and fair to those who continue putting their life on the line for all Americans.
I enjoyed meeting with BM1 Jason Finch today at Singing River Island!

This morning, the House Judiciary Committee marked up and passed H.R. 38, the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act, that I helped introduce again this Congress.  This common sense legislation will provide law-abiding citizens the right to conceal carry and travel freely between states without worrying about conflicting state codes. As a sportsman and an NRA life member, I strongly support Second Amendment rights and the protection of individuals to keep and bear arms.   After Democrat's countless attempts to infringe on your constitutional rights, I'm glad to see this bill moving forward in the house.

It was a pleasure hosting the 24th Secretary of the Air Force, Heather Wilson, in my Washington, D.C. office this morning.   Secretary Wilson graduated from the U.S. Air Force Academy in the third class that included women. She earned her master's and doctorate degrees as a Rhodes Scholar at Oxford University in England. From 1982 to 1989, she served as an officer in the Air Force.   It was great to thank her for her service and leadership that she has displayed over her lifetime. I look forward to her visiting the Mississippi Gulf Coast in the near future!
Golden Eagles are going to the INDY Bowl to play against Florida State! Well deserved and a great way to end a successful season #SMTTT
Looking forward to joining JT today on Supertalk at 12:00pm CST!

Today we passed one of the most important pieces of gun legislation in the past 10 years. Concealed Carry Reciprocity is an assurance to Americans that their constitutional right to carry a firearm is protected, regardless of which state they are in.   There are a handful of misinformed individuals saying that the fix-NICS portion of this bill would allow for judges to take guns without adjudication, these are not just misleading statements, they are outright lies.  This bill doesn't prohibit a single individual from buying a gun, it makes sure people who weren't supposed to have guns in the first place, can't get guns. It helps those who are wrongly prohibited from buying a gun get off the list more quickly.

"Yesterday, December 7, 1941 - a date which will live in infamy - the United States of America was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan" - President Franklin D. Roosevelt  Today, 76 years ago our military answered the call to defend our freedom with a reinvigorated passion and motivation to protect our citizens and our homeland.   Today we remember and honor the brave heroes who met the Japanese attack with bravery and strength in 1941. We will never forget their courage or their commitment to serve the greatest country on earth.

AMERICA WILL ONCE AGAIN REACH FOR THE MOON!  When our Space Shuttle program ended in 2011, American astronauts were forced to hitch a ride from other countries into outer space. With President Trump, we are working to put American Astronauts, on American-made rockets, with American-made engines, that are launched from American soil.  With the unanimous support from the recently revived National Space Council, today, President Trump has signed a space policy directive for NASA, to put American Astronauts back on the moon.   We will continue working to make America a leader in space exploration once again, so that American astronauts are now driving space exploration from the front seat.  Next stop? The moon.

Today, President Trump signed the National Defense Authorization Act for FY18 into law, which includes the biggest pay raise for our troops in eight years and permanently preserves benefits for surviving military spouses.   The NDAA fully supports our military and calls for an increase in the number of Navy ships produced as President Trump has continuously requested as part of his initiative to build up our military, including an additional destroyer and funding for the LPD-30 both of which are manufactured in Jackson County at Ingalls   President Trump promised to rebuild our military and protect the American people both at home and abroad and today he is keeping that promise. Providing for the common defense of this nation remains our number one constitutional responsibility. Our men and women in uniform are the best in the world at what they do, and we owe it to them to ensure they always have the tools and resources they need to get the job done!

Good news for our Gulf Coast Fisheries! Yesterday the House Natural Resources Committee on passage of H.R. 3588, the Red Snapper Act of which I’m an original co-sponsor, as well as H.R. 200, the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, which included provisions of The Modern Fish Act that I co-sponsored in April of this year.   Fisheries data is not being adequately managed on a federal level. This year’s announcement of the three day snapper season was resounding proof of that. Our fishermen have suffered unfairly from an excessively shrinking snapper season for the past decade, and these bills will provide our states with the power they need to manage their own fisheries.   Throughout this year, my gulf coast colleagues and I have been successful in working with the new leadership within the Department of Commerce, and finally making strides to provide relief for our recreational fishermen at home. Yesterday’s passage of this legislation in committee is another giant step towards finding a long-term solution to this extremely important issue to the Mississippi Gulf Coast.

Signed, sealed, DELIVERED.   This week Congress and President Trump accomplished a huge legislative victory and WIN for the American people. Making our tax code fair and simple is something I’ve called for since entering Congress, and I’m proud of this historic moment.   ✔️ Obamacare individual mandate tax penalty, REPEALED  ✔️Doubled the standard deduction   ✔️Expanded the child tax credit  ✔️decreased the corporate rate from 35% to 21%   This bill restores American competitiveness, better serves small businesses. You deserve to keep more of your money.   The proof will be in your paycheck.
